intro: Sedum vigilmontis, commonly known as the Vigilmont sedum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is native to South America, specifically Argentina, and thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, fleshy leaves, and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. It is a succulent, capable of storing water in its leaves, making it drought-tolerant. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
